p: Volatile oil from C. sinensis peel contains naringin and naringenin as two kinds of flavonoids which have anti-diabetic and antioxidant properties [ 60]. Polymethoxylated flavones (PMFs) of C. sinensis have hypolipidemic effects, resulting in a significant reduction of insulin tolerance and glucose levels [ 61]. Furthermore, according to other research, a mixture of onion, ginger, basil, cinnamon, orange peel, yellow and red watermelon seeds, and carrot seed could significantly affect the CAT level and reduce the OS [ 62]. All of this research is consistent with our study.
